title: Amazon to open corporate office in Detroit in early 2016
text:
Amazon to open corporate office in Detroit in early 2016 September 28, 2015 
Online retailer Amazon plans to open a corporate office in Detroit in early 2016. 
Seattle-based Amazon says it has hundreds of Michigan employees and on Monday announced it wants the downtown office to be a technology hub. 
Amazon says the office will mean more full-time technology-focused jobs, but the company didn't say how many jobs it would add. Peter Faricy, vice president for Amazon Marketplace, says in a statement that Amazon is "focused on hiring in the state." 
The office will house workers with roles including software development, engineering and advertising sales . 
As part of the announcement, Amazon is donating $10,000 and 30 Amazon Fire tablets to the Detroit Public Schools' Carver STEM Academy program.
